multiplechoiceresponse.label: Which of the following is a key difference between traditional autoencoders and variational autoencoders (VAEs)?
multiplechoiceresponse.description: You can add an optional tip or note related to the prompt like this.

choicegroup.choice: VAEs introduce an element of randomness through probabilistic sampling.
VAEs use a deterministic latent layer while traditional autoencoders use a probabilistic one.
VAEs only reconstruct the input data, while traditional autoencoders can generate new data.
Traditional autoencoders are unsupervised while VAEs are supervised.
